Sir Rod Stewart could be in breach of strict cyber-crime laws after he was filmed seeming to mimic a beheading in a video. 
Legal experts have warned the United Arab Emirates' laws forbid people from inciting religious contempt, discrimination or hatred. 
Radha Stirling, legal consultant for Detained in Dubai, said: “I can cite precedents where they have put people in prison for lesser crimes than this.” 
The families of killer Jihadi John ’s victims have branded the singer “disgusting”. 
The singer has offered his “deepest apologies”, but said his actions in the Abu Dhabi desert were “misinterpreted”. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Rod Stewart appears to perform mock EXECUTION in Abu Dhabi desert Share this video Watch Next 
The singer, 72, was filmed forcing a male friend to kneel in front of him, then holding his hair and making a cutting motion across his throat. 
Sir Rod, who performed in Abu Dhabi on Thursday on his world tour, said: “From re-enacting the Beatles’ Abbey Road crossing to spontaneously playing out Game Of Thrones, we were simply larking about pre-show. 
“Understandably, this has been misinterpreted and I send my deepest apologies to those who have been offended.” Read More Sir Rod Stewart apologises over Jihadi John mock execution video, saying it was actually Game of Thrones scene Rod standing behind his friend 
Relatives of aid workers Alan Henning , 47, and David Haines, 44, who were beheaded in Syria in 2014 by Islamic State terrorist Jihadi John – Londoner Mohammed Emwazi, 27 – were disgusted by the film. 
It was put on Instagram by Rod’s wife Penny Lancaster, 45, but then deleted. 
Alan Henning’s daughter, Lucy, 19, said: “Nothing will ever hurt more than the real murders. I just see this as a really silly mistake by Rod and I hope he learns from this – that anything he does can reach the world and hurt people. Penny rolls down the sand dunes, while her husband is seen in the background (Photo: Instagram / penny.lancaster) 
“Hopefully, he can turn this into something positive and help those who do matter – the ones still in Syria who desperately need our help.” 
David Haines ’ widow Dragana, 47, and daughter Bethany, 18, were shocked by the footage. 
Mrs Haines said: “I am appalled by Sir Rod Stewart’s sick sense of humour. I really wonder if he would find it funny if he lost his loved one in such a vicious and savage way. I’m disgusted somebody could find this entertaining. ISIS beheading victim Alan Henning (Photo: PA) David Haines Jihadi John Mohammed Emwazi (Photo: REUTERS) 
“Rod is 72 years old. That’s pretty brainless. I don’t ­understand how someone could do something like that. 
“It’s disgusting.” 
Bethany added: “I think it’s disgraceful. There are some things that are funny, but that isn’t. This actually happened to my dad and it’s not something to joke about.” 
Former hostage John ­McCarthy, 60, yesterday said the singer had turned “a grotesque thing into a kind of pantomime”. Like us on Facebook
